meanings.definition: Exerting force on something in order to move it away from oneself.
meanings.sent1: She was pushing the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: The children were pushing each other on the swings at the park.
meanings.sent3: He kept pushing the door that clearly said 'pull'.
meanings.sent4: The wind was pushing the clouds swiftly across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The determined squirrel was pushing the acorn up the tree trunk.

meanings.sent1: The company was pushing their new product through advertisements.
meanings.sent2: She was pushing for more environmentally friendly policies in the government.
meanings.sent3: He was pushing the idea of having ice cream for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was pushing the importance of reading to the students.
meanings.sent5: The team was pushing for equal opportunities for all players.

meanings.definition: Approaching a certain age or time.
meanings.sent1: The pushing deadline for the project made everyone work harder.
meanings.sent2: She felt the pushing years as she celebrated her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The pushing season of harvest brought excitement to the farmers.
meanings.sent4: The pushing evening sky signaled the end of a beautiful day.
meanings.sent5: The pushing train schedule meant they had to hurry to catch it.
